data.title: So what exactly is wrong with the 1998 Godzilla movie?
data.meta_description:
Never fully seen it, but I hear Godzilla fans hate it with a passion. In fact, Toho designates it as “Zilla” as it took the God out of Godzilla.

min the...

Nov 5, 2021

#1

Never fully seen it, but I hear Godzilla fans hate it with a passion. In fact, Toho designates it as "Zilla" as it took the God out of Godzilla.

min the plus side, it did spawn a pretty decent animated series that's pretty underrated.

Nov 5, 2021

#13

I loved it as a kid, and still think it's an incredibly fun corny piece of 90s blockbuster camp. Will watch it anytime.

Now, is it almost intentionally disrespectful of existing Godzilla lore & design? Yes it is. Does it rip off sequences & camera tricks from multiple other famous blockbusters? Yes it does. Does it go out of its' way to drag Siskel & Ebert through the dirt for the crime of not liking Roland Emmerich's other trash movies? Indeed it does. Still love it.

Oct 25, 2017

2,250

Nov 5, 2021

#14

Never fully seen it, but I hear Godzilla fans hate it with a passion. In fact, Toho designates it as "Zilla" as it took the God out of Godzilla.

min the plus side, it did spawn a pretty decent animated series that's pretty underrated.

It was heavily inspired by the success of Jurassic Park, so the 1998 Godzilla is more like a larger T-Rex than a giant monster that stands amongst skyscrapers.

Also, Godzilla jobs to a bunch of attack helicopters

Godzilla is a nearly indestructible force of nature with a real fighting spirit.

Scarlet Spider

One Winged Slayer

Oct 25, 2017

5,823

Brooklyn, NY

Nov 5, 2021

#18

Godzilla 1998 is divisive for making the creature a mutated Iguana that is relatively weak and would prefer to avoid confrontation. Compared to its offspring in the sequel cartoon that is actually more like standard Godzilla. I never hated it, I enjoyed it as a child and still enjoy it today. Minus the romance nonsense.

Some fans being unable to get over it and still acting like the movie came to their house and shot their pet. Some people liked it, some hated it, some didn't care. Godzilla went from a tragic beast to a dancing super hero, to a vengeful monster, to an iguana, to a ghost, to a mutated sea creature, to a literal walking plant, to an interdimensional alien. Some incarnations of Godzilla are hated more than others, it's just the nature of things. Your mileage will vary.

Besides Toho even included Godzilla 1998 in their Godzilla calendar for their 67th anniversary a few days ago. He ain't hated like he used to be, at least from what I've seen in Japan.

#49

it's a pretty fun monster movie just not a great adaptation of godzilla

since then people have embraced Zilla as a unique kaiju, and it's been incorporated into godzilla's "rogues gallery" as a typically peaceful kaiju with notable resemblance to godzilla

technically "Zilla" (as it later appears in comics and japanese movies) and the 1998 "Godzilla" are still legally distinct characters, but in practical usage it's all Zilla now and 98 serves as its origin movie where americans mistake it for a godzilla
